info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 3:29PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTH CENTRAL SANTA FE COUNTY THROUGH 400 PM MDT... At 329 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Rio En Medio in Santa Fe County, or 9 miles south of Chimayo, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pojoaque, Nambe Lake, Nambe Pueblo, Rio En Medio in Santa Fe County, Cuyamungue, Chupadero and Cundiyo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
